title: From Old to New Economy
segmentation: Organizers, ladies and gentlemen, I feel very honored and I'm pleased to receive the European Data Award on behalf of my organization.
I'd like to thank the panel of Judges and the representatives of the European Commission.
For the great recognition that we at Daimler have been given with this award.
Due to the model of this year's EBIT share economy from owning to sharing, I would like to share some of the experiences we made with linked data in the following charts.
OK, here I get the following.
That's that's perfect.
I want to talk about a little bit of the structural changes of old economy.
Leading over to the evolution of the Internet of Things.
The four principles of Link data link data activities at Daimler Little bit on technical and cultural changes and last but not least, wrap up for the today's session.
Let's start with the.
Evolution of traditi
Companies.
Manufacturing companies like ours.
In the automotive, automotive sectors are experiencing a really deep structural change.
More and more information technology is determining our everyday professional life.
Whether it is the production itself, the Developlment computer aided design, or the connected car in itself, data is our asset and data is helping our life to be easier day by day.
The trench will continue to intensify in the future, and it's obvious the classic it and the core business of manufacturing companies are continually moving closer together.
New economy and old economy are emerging.
This is especially seen in one special effect.

This is our link to the customer which in the past has been through dealers very indirectly today with the connected car we have the possibility to directly communicate with our customers and have them in connected with us in all times.
This requires corporate it to rethink strategically its organizational structure, its priorities, and the use of resources in the day-to-day business.
We at Daimler have realized that link data and open data can be crucial drivers for using the innovation of data economy or for sustainably supporting the discribed structural change.
Let's take a closer look at the topic of linked data.
What does link data mean for old economies?
The first basic idea for the Internet can be traced back to the research of the early 60s as the network collaboration of the of decentralized computers.
And these centralized computers.
30 years ago, the World Wide Web emerges.
Not to the thanks to Tim Berners Lee at the CERN research centers.
Mainly responsible for the breakthrough of the Internet was a worldwide establishment of concepts such as hypertext in your eye or as well as a standards HTTP protocol in the HTML language.
The establishment of the corresponding browser technologies made it possible to display any content wherever you are in the world.
And promoted at the end the development of the Internet.
There was no longer anything standing in the way of a worldwide use of HTML as a technology to bridge the human machine interface.

Where do we stand today beginning as a nice service of tech savvy minority, the Internet has developed into an offer that is penetrating all social classes and groups we can no longer imagine our lives without it and it has gained a central importance for businesses.
My 13 year old daughter just recently asked me Daddy, is it true that there was no Internet in former times and I said yeah, yeah, actually that was true.
It was when I was at your age the Internet was just not there and she stared at me and couldn't believe it.
Today the Internet is everywhere everyday.
New Internet applications are development.
The cycle where new Internet technologies emerged are becoming even shorter.
The amount of data that the Internet comprises.
Is growing by leaps and bounds.
Data integration is nothing.
If nothing else, the linked open data Cloud has shown this is growing enormously.

This is exactly why organizations such as the W. 3C, which which since its foundation in 90 four, has made great efforts to develop and establish technical standards for the W 3 and also hugely important.
Even for us as a non Internet company that has that has to use Internet technologies more and more and rely on the sustainability of the solutions we use.
Standardization is of great importance.
We need binding and open standards as to how applications communicate with others, and data can be used, compared competitively got compatibility.
This isn't only a matter of bridging the human machine interface, because we already use HTML for that, but also matter for the worldwide use of standards for bridging the machine machine interface.
And that's just what link data does, which is why I consider the topic which we have seized on for our company.
And the reason why we are receiving the European Data Innovator Award today so groundbreaking.
Central.
For our work.
We were and are the four linked data principles.
As they are formulated by Tim Berners Lee in 2006.
Youth, who arrive as Matter's name for things.
Use HTTP UI so that people can look up those names.
Where someone looks up to you or I provide useful information using the standards like RDF or Sparkle, and last but not least include links to other your eyes so that they can discover more things.
The corresponding W 3 standards such as RDF owl and Sparkle will bring the quality of data representations and data networking.
To a whole new level, information objects will now receive a certain meaning in the linguistic sense and will be able to be proceeded, processed correspondingly by machines.
As we all know the scenario I have outlined.
Is not a dream.
Castle in the air.
But rather already a live living reality today, thanks to the linked Open Data Cloud.
Crucial for this is also the idea of crowd sourcing.
Using the wisdom of the masses based on the ideas of the Web 2.0.
In order to create and maintain networks of knowledge.
The linked open data Cloud has impressively demonstrated how this can work.
The question now is how the insights I have outlined can find their way from the free Internet into our enterprise intranets.
Let's take a closer look at our solutions at Daimler.
For approximately 1 1/2 year we have been concentrating on the use of link data in the business environment.
For this we founded a multidisciplinary work group consisting of colleagues both from it and various other specialist departments.

This work group, which is now more like a community, is responsible for the screening of application scenarios and for the creation and testing of technical concepts, all having to do with linked data.
The group was able to verify, for example, the usability of this technology for various use cases with several proof of concepts.
I will now explain the individual scenarios that we considered and the proof of concepts we conducted.
The first proof of concept examined how the search function on our company webpage can be improved substantially for our users.
We created an initial combined network of knowledge using various existing.
Existing internal dictionaries and produce data which we then linked with content on our Internet web pages.
This resulted in brand new experiences for the customers.
For example, customers could now also create complex search requests in order to be led to the desired product page more quickly.
Our second proof of concept examined content creation process is.

Such as those used in creating opera operating instructions by using an underlying network of knowledge, we were able to use a semi automated process to substantially improve the tagging of the content based on predefined concepts of predefined concepts.
This also revealed that the mechanism examined is suitable for easily applying standardized vocabularies while content is being created.
Direct access to the network of knowledge during content creation.
Allows an editor to use and to further develop this standardized vocabulary based on the idea of crowdsourcing.
This ensures that the standardized vocabulary used is also considered as a part of a common organization, creating value and that is actively embraced and developed further.
The 1st and the 2nd proof of concepts.
Having been have been pure internal experiments, so to say with Link data technology for the third proof of concept, we choose to enhance an application which is in life operation today.
For this we selected the search function on our German product page.
Wanting to show how semantic search technologies can make for an improved user experience.

Correspondingly, our colleagues from marketing and Artie implemented the first prototype of linked data technologies on our product side WWW, Mercedes-Benz TE with the so called flyout search between September and December 2012.
This was an advanced search function on our website in order to enable a concept based semantic search.
This function is called flyout because the correspondent search results fly out into the browser window.
Why the user is typing?
The way the new search function works can be explained using a concrete example from the Mercedes-Benz.

The website based on the German Nomenclature, nomenclature, visitor searching for German Combi or in English, it would be station wagon related product while typing the letter STA for the word station.
The variety of fitting search results appears in the flyout window.
Both concrete station vehicle types.
As well as corresponding product highlights are displayed.
Although we had Daimler produce T models, that's our internal names for station wagon and not station wagons.
The combined network of knowledge behind the search function associate station wagon.
Correspondingly with synonyms such as station wagon or the T model leading the customers to the right results.
Enriching the underlying network of knowledge with additional synonyms allows the common technology terminology of the customer to be mapped and considered in searches.
The impressive and convincing thing about this use of Link data technology was that we were able to conceptualize and implement this prototype within only three months.
Despite our complex world of information, it makes it really makes you want more.
As you can see.
The potential in applying link data technology is very diverse for Daimler.
We see various application scenarios for the technology this includes in addition to semantic search applications and the segmented search engine optimization.
Above all, the internal publication and consumption of all types of master data from master product data to master organizational data to Master accounting data.
A further crucial factor, more or less, the byproduct of the consistent use of this technology will be the increase of information quality in our content creation process.
Is the implementation of standardized vocabularies in product creation and the support of logistic processes, and much much more.
What does the future hold?
For the link data technology at Daimler.
I think that the proof of concepts we conducted have shown that link data is a promising technology in order to be able to meet the challenges of our business.
However, I must emphasize that we cannot leave this with a pure technology technological observation.
Link Data is a matter of opening data silos so that data can be consumed.
Of course, this also requires a rethinking at the level of corporate culture.
Departments must see set aside their silo thinking, and on the other hand make their data accessible, but on the other hand also understand it as information with a reference to context.
You can imagine that this requires persuasion and the gift to be able to still.
Still the fears of those affected with regards to generated data transparency.
Fears must also be considered when establishing the idea of crowdsourcing.
In short, the use of linked data also means a substantial cultural change for organizations.
But let's go back to the technical level.
From research and practice we know that Corporation is the number one successful factor in any single product creation project.
From a technology technical point of view, corporations require the integration of data from various source systems.
In product creation, for example, drawing data from CAD systems has to be linked with the parts list data and production planning data.
If we succeed in making our data silos accessible using open standards, and if it succeeds in understanding this data is valuable information in a larger context.
We then we are creating the essential basis for efficient product creation.

Human work becomes more efficient when the underlying systems are connected to one another without media discontinuity and the person be at the designer engineer, the product engineer or the logistic expert is able to concentrate on his or her own task.
Therefore, technological and cultural change must go hand in hand.
To return to my opening statement and therefore to the topic of the data economy, I consider linked data.

Both the underlying technology and cultural concepts, as well as a corresponding technology technological standards to be a crucial instrument for driving the data economy transformation process in our company.
For this purpose, I would like to make the following four points.
Link data is really a lean technology it saves.
Resources.
The technology is sustainable and reliable.
Because it makes use of W 3 standards and is also used on the Internet today.
The technology is flexible and application neutral.
It can be used in various corporate domains providing a lightweight approach to system integration.
The technology drives the cultural change of our company to a more open culture and a more transparent and easier way to manage data as a value adding information.
It motivates all those involved to think about new integrated information, use concepts and additional add value.
In short, Link data technology and the cultural concept and important component for implementing information technology, structural change in manufacturing companies.
The technology fulfills internal customers requirements or in simple words it adds value.
And for those reasons we're time law will continue to commit ourselves to the use of linked data technology in our various corporate context and on the Internet.
I'm very eager to see what the future will bring.
Before I come to the conclusion.

I would address a request to the European Commission and the governmental bodies in Europe to really rethink our data protection laws, because one thing which stands sometimes between the efficient lose of data and technology are the regulations and we really have to rethink what kind of data is really to be considered private.
What kind of data is kind of public?
And what kind of protection level we have to put around it in order to make it accessible on the one hand side, and obviously to respect the privacy of people but this.
The the concept of privacy has changed in the world of Internet when I use it.
When I see the young guys using applications like WhatsApp, I'm really questioning what is the privacy factor of a mobile phone number or email address in the future.
But still because of regulations we are forced to protect these kind of data in internal environments to a very very high level which in the external Internet use.

They are kind of open, openly available, so therefore here the framework would help us to ease the use of data in the future and I'm really encouraging governmental bodies to rethink their strict frame words with frameworks which we have at the moment.
In conclusion at this point I would once again like to say thank you for the price.
We have been awarded.
I would also like to use this opportunity to encourage the industry industrial representatives present here to take the first steps forward towards link data.

Even if the topic seems very complex and challenging at first glance, I can assure you that a deeper look into it is worth it, so you wouldn't be here if you're not really interested, I can tell you the payout is much higher than the effort you put in there.
The technology offers enormous potential benefit from it, just as we have benefit from it so far, and we surely continue to benefit from it in the future.
Set the stage for data economy.
In your company too, thank you very much for your attention and I wish you all a good conference.
